metadata.title: CVE-2017-3635 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Connectors component of Oracle MySQL(subcomponent: Connector/C). Supported versions that are affected are6.1.10 and earlier. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Connectors. Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Connectors. Note: The documentation has alsobeen updated for the correct way to use mysql_stmt_close(). Please see:https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/mysql-stmt-execute.html,https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/mysql-stmt-fetch.html,https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/mysql-stmt-close.html,https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/mysql-stmt-error.html,https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/mysql-stmt-errno.html, andhttps://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/mysql-stmt-sqlstate.html. CVSS 3.0Base Score 5.3 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3635` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-common - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.19-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
percona-xtradb-cluster-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
percona-server-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
